title: Palestinians: Israeli fire kills teen in West Bank
description: Palestinian Health Ministry says Israeli forces shot dead a teenage boy in the north of the occupied West Bank, the latest in a flare-up of bloody violence that has raged for months

title: Iranian warships in Rio de Janeiro stirring concern abroad
description: The arrival this week to Rio de Janeiro of two Iranian warships that Brazil’s government authorized to dock has prompted rebukes both from Israel and the U.S. On Thursday, one of the two ships was spotted off shore Rio’s world-famous south zone of beaches, while the other was docked downtown

title: Greta Andersen, Olympic gold medalist and marathon swimmer, dies at 95
description: After winning a gold medal at the 1948 Olympics, Ms. Andersen became the world’s greatest marathon swimmer, regularly trouncing men.

title: US ambassador Cindy McCain to head U.N. World Food Program
description: U.S. Ambassador Cindy McCain has been appointed head of the U.N. World Food Program, the world’s largest humanitarian organization which aims to help nearly 150 million people confronting conflicts, disasters and climate change impacts this year

title: New Easter Island statue found in volcanic crater's dry lake
description: Researchers have found a new moai statue in a dry lake on the Chilean island of Rapa Nui, joining the approximately 1,000 other iconic monolithic sculptures on what is internationally known as Easter Island

title: Gunmen leave threatening note for Lionel Messi at in-laws’ store
description: Gunmen left a note reading “We’re waiting for you” at the scene of a shooting in Messi’s hometown in Argentina, police said.

title: Years of warnings and inaction in Turkish city destroyed by earthquakes
description: Adiyaman wasn't ready for a powerful quake, experts told the government. But little was done to protect residents in the city’s most vulnerable structures.

title: Why Sara Netanyahu's hair salon trip ended with riot police
description: Israeli protesters’ siege of a Tel Aviv beauty parlor where Sara Netanyahu was getting her hair done has cast a spotlight on the Israeli prime minister’s wife, a divisive figure long been intertwined with her husband’s political career

title: Kremlin accuses Ukraine of violent attack in western Russia
description: The governor of Bryansk said two people were killed in a shooting incident that President Vladimir Putin denounced as a “terrorist attack.” Ukraine denied responsibility.

title: Looted Kandinsky work restored to Jewish heirs fetches $45M
description: A painting by Wassily Kandinsky that spent decades in a Dutch museum after its Jewish owner was murdered in the Holocaust has sold at auction for 37.2 million pounds ($44.9 million)

title: Nurse faces legal action for 'faking' Spanish kids' vaccines
description: A Spanish lawyer says 42 families in Spain are pursuing legal action against a nurse whom they allege faked the process of administering routine vaccines to their children

title: Israeli campaign raises funds for torched Palestinian town
description: An Israeli-led crowdfunding campaign has raised hundreds of thousands of dollars for Palestinian residents of a West Bank town that was set ablaze by radical Jewish settlers this week

title: This government aide says it knows what voters want. It’s an AI bot.
description: Romanian officials say the AI bot, called Ion, can automatically detect voters' concerns and voice them back to elected officials.

title: Ukraine uncovers new grave near Bucha, site of alleged Russian atrocities
description: Ukrainian authorities exhumed three bodies from a newly found grave near Bucha, the Kyiv suburb where alleged atrocities by Russian troops spurred global outrage.

title: When Michelin tells chefs they’ve lost stars, mental health is top of mind
description: The Michelin guide said it is "fully aware" of its impact on restaurants and chefs' mental health after Guy Savoy and Christopher Coutanceau lost their third stars.

title: More than 1,000 earthquake survivors are sheltering on a cruise ship in Turkey
description: The Gemini, a huge luxury cruise ship docked in the Iskenderun Port, has become a temporary shelter for Turkish earthquake survivors.

title: Iran nuclear advance challenges U.S. as time to potential bomb shortens
description: A new U.N. report asserting that Iran has enriched uranium particles to 83.7 percent purity has thrust the Biden administration into tough choices.

title: EU to speed up deliveries of howitzer shells for Ukraine
description: The European Union is setting up a joint procurement plan to speed up the delivery of howitzer artillery rounds that Ukraine says are crucial to countering Russian forces

title: Almost 200 rights groups call on U.N. to intervene over U.S. abortion access
description: The United States cannot be a global champion of human rights when its own abortion rights are not protected, one signatory to the letter to the United Nations said.

title: Israeli campaign raises funds for torched Palestinian town
description: An Israeli-led crowdfunding campaign has raised hundreds of thousands of dollars for Palestinian residents of a West Bank town that was set ablaze by radical Jewish settlers this week

title: Fukushima plant head: Too early to predict decommissioning
description: The head of Japan’s wrecked Fukushima nuclear plant says details of the damage inside its reactors are only beginning to be known 12 years after it was hit by a massive earthquake and tsunami, making it difficult to foresee when or how its decommissioning will be completed

title: One more man arrested in case of slain Hong Kong model
description: Hong Kong police have arrested a man accused of assisting another suspect in the gruesome killing of model Abby Choi, whose dismembered body parts were found in a refrigerator

title: WHO urges assistance to African nations facing cholera
description: A World Health Organization official in Africa is urging more support to countries facing cholera outbreaks, saying the disease has the potential to “quickly explode” as rainfall persists in some areas

title: In Greece, deep problems with rail network preceded deadly collision
description: As emergency workers continued to pick through the charred carriages, Greeks were turning their focus to a rail system that had long been in worrisome shape.

title: The U.K. is experiencing historic strikes. These stories explain why.
description: People told The Post about taking out loans to pay bills, telling their kids to keep the heating off and no longer being able to afford fruit.

title: Blinken has rare encounter with Russia’s Lavrov at G-20 meeting in India
description: It is their first face-to-face meeting since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: These Ukrainian villagers live in Cold War nuclear bunkers — and plan to stay
description: Svitlana Gynzhul and other villagers in Luch, Ukraine, turned Cold War nuclear bunkers into homes after Russian shelling devastated their town.

title: India wanted to avoid a Ukraine fight at G-20. World powers had other plans.
description: India's Narendra Modi hoped to unite the world around food and energy security at the G-20, but for the Western alliance the Russia-Ukraine war was the focus.

title: 23% in Germany are immigrants, children of immigrants
description: Some 18.9 million people, or 23% of Germany’s population, have either immigrated to the country since 1950 or are the children of immigrants

title: Pakistan frees retired general accused of inciting violence
description: A Pakistani defense lawyer says a court has released an anti-government retired army general who is a vocal supporter of the country’s popular former prime minister

title: Netanyahu denounces protesters after salon siege of his wife
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his allies say protesters are “anarchists” after they gathered outside a Tel Aviv salon where his wife was getting her hair done

title: ‘Noah’ and ‘Daren’ report good news about Venezuela. They’re deepfakes.
description: Researchers say the videos are part of Venezuelan leaders' attempts to spin the narrative on social media, one of the country's last bastions of free speech.

title: Pregnant Russians are streaming into Argentina. Officials are suspicious.
description: Authorities say Russians are taking advantage of the country's comparatively open immigration rules by arriving, giving birth, applying for passports and leaving.

title: Danish queen discharged from hospital after back surgery
description: Denmark’s Queen Margrethe II, whose half-century reign makes her Europe’s longest-serving monarch, has been discharged from a Copenhagen hospital

title: Denmark: Statue of Little Mermaid vandalized again
description: The famed statue of Hans Christian Andersen’s Little Mermaid, one of Copenhagen’s biggest tourist draws, has been vandalized, with the colors of the Russian flag painted on the rock on which she sits

title: Egypt raises price of gasoline in latest hike amid inflation
description: Egypt has announced it is raising the price of some types of gasoline, the latest hike to beset the cash-strapped North African country

title: Greek rail workers strike over conditions after deadly crash
description: Rescuers using cranes and heavy machinery are searching the wreckage of trains involved in a deadly collision that sent Greece into national mourning and has prompted strikes and protests over rail safety

title: Russian strike on Ukraine apartment block kills 3, injures 6
description: Officials say three people were killed and six were injured when a Russian missile hit a five-story apartment building in city in southeastern Ukraine as the war extends into its second year

title: Africa’s largest economy is running out of cash. Here’s why.
description: Nigeria is replacing high-denomination naira, but a shortage of new notes has led to protests and riots as millions stand in ATM lines for hours.

title: Extradited Indian charged with murder in Australian city
description: Australian police have charged Indian national Rajwinder Singh in the 2018 killing of Toyah Cordingley as she walked her dog along a Queensland beach

title: 20 injured by turbulence aboard Germany to Mauritius flight
description: Several people have been injured in turbulence during a flight from Frankfurt to Mauritius

title: What's driving the players behind Israel's legal overhaul?
description: Proponents of the Israeli government’s planned legal overhaul often argue that curtailing the power of judges and courts is good for the country

title: Ukraine live briefing: War to dominate agenda at G-20 meeting in Delhi
description: Foreign ministers of the world’s major economies, including Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Russia's Sergei Lavrov, are set to discuss the conflict.

title: British navy seizes Iran missiles, parts likely Yemen bound
description: The British navy seized anti-tank missiles and fins for ballistic missile assemblies during a raid on a small boat heading from Iran likely to Yemen

title: Sakharov Center forced to close as wartime Russia purges human rights groups
description: The center, dedicated to the legendary dissident Andrei Sakharov, is one of several Russian human rights organizations being dismantled in wartime Russia.

title: Over 26,000 evacuated as floods hit Malaysia again; 1 dead
description: Rescuers in boats have retrieved families trapped on rooftops and hauled others to safety as villages in parts of Malaysia were submerged in floodwaters

title: Does Europe face a demographic crisis?
description: An interview with Dubravka Suica, vice president of the European Commission, who is responsible for demography and democracy on the continent.
